title: Vaccine Information
description: Learn the latest COVID-19 vaccination information for northern Michigan from Munson Healthcare. Find out when and where you can receive your COVID-19 vaccine.
cleaned_text: Vaccine Information COVID-19 vaccine eligibility in Michigan is open to anyone 6 months+. COVID-19 vaccines and boosters help protect the health of our communities by preventing severe symptoms, including those that can lead to hospitalization or death. Munson Healthcare follows CDC guidelines for who can receive a booster shot, including updated boosters. Please click below for the most up-to-date guidelines. What to Expect When Getting the Vaccine It's normal to experience mild side effects after receiving your COVID-19 vaccine. These are signs that your body is building protection against the virus. These symptoms may last up to 36 hours. If you experience a severe side effect or you feel you are having an allergic reaction, please call 911 immediately. More COVID-19 Resources From our comprehensive Parent's Guide to COVID-19 to our bite-sized informational Munson Minutes series, we offer you a variety of ways to learn more about COVID-19 and the available vaccines.
